name: Ramada Plaza Hotel - Downtown Convention Center

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel while I attended a conference that was held in the convention center. The room had two queen size beds that were comfortable. We stayed on the third floor and never had to wait long for an elevator. I chose the hotel for its convenient location and free Wi-Fi in the rooms. The location was great, but I never got the free
reviews.title: Excellent location for convention lodging; poorly trained staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wi-Fi in my room due to reception problems. I had to sit either in the lobby or at a table in the pool area to get reception. Apparently, the rooms on one side of the hotel get reception; my side did not. I found it interesting that I was able to connect to a pay Internet provider in the room.
reviews.title: Chaos in St. Louis

reviews.text: I ate breakfast and lunch on most days at the hotel. The buffets were fairly tasty, but the food service staff needed additional training. They were nice, but somewhat backwards. I ate dinner in the bar area one night and was surprised that customers were allowed to smoke where I was eating. That was unpleasant.
reviews.title: Better than expected (++)

reviews.text: Even though there was room for improvement, I would stay there again. I was able to walk to the convention center in two or three minutes.
reviews.title: Don't pay extra for the breakfast buffet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a terrible customer service experience at this hotel. While the rooms were updated and comfortable, the staffing and infrastructure are a mess. Every staffing area of the facility appeared under staffed and poorly trained. At check in there was a long line one guy behind the counter and phones blaring with other guests or potential guests looking for service. Behind the desk was a dissassembled circuit box with wires all over the place. Breakfast was a disaster. Two workers for an entire restaurant. Ran out of silverware, ran out of coffee, the workers were crabby and about ready to walk out. Came back to the bar area at night and had to wait with other patrons for over 5 minutes before anyone was behind the bar. Toilets on first floor covered and out of order. Broken window pane in entrance.
reviews.title: Hot, Sweaty, Dirty, Loud and a Rash to boot

reviews.text: Stayed one night and enjoyed the location of this hotel. It is close to everything in downtown St-Louis. Service was excellent and very friendly. Breakfast is not included but excellent with lots of choices. Would return again.
reviews.title: Great Location and Great Service !

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Great Place Near the Arch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Two blocks from the arch
reviews.title: What makes this Select?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Beautiful lobby
reviews.title: Not too bad.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Hotwire rate: $49
reviews.title: Just Okay

reviews.text: I read some complaints and was skeptical to book at this hotel.
reviews.title: We would stay there again

reviews.text: The staff at the front desk was very nice. The elevators were not slow, and I was able to get internet service. We had three rooms, two on the 4th floor overlooking the pool (426, 428) Very nice rooms, and clean. Yes we paid for parking, but all hotels in this area charge for parking. At some hotels in this area you have to park a lot farther away from the hotel itself. We had no problems with our room and we would stay there again. Very close to everything, a very, very short walk to Washington.
reviews.title: Great Looking, Friendly, Professional, Comfortable

reviews.text: I don't know what the complaints were about.
reviews.title: Need Internet? Don't stay here. Tired.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Downtown (Conv Center) and was very pleased with the renovations. The lobby was amazing and looked very modern and comfortable. It didn't have the old Holiday Inn look, but rather an upscale look like the high dollar, down town hotels. When I checked in, it went very quickly and smoothly - I was greeted as a Priority customer and given extras - paper, later check out time. My room was clean, comfortable and there were no problems with noise or supplies.
reviews.title: A mess at first!!!!

reviews.text: My overall felling about this hotel is that I would rather stay here than any other hotel in downtown St Louis. The price is very reasonable and the amenities great!
reviews.title: Should have known better
Not Good
reviews.text: Yes, this place SMELLS bad! The rooms are just OK, barely OK. The carpets are dirty and the walls are paper thin. Service is to be desired. For a nickel more, go first class to the Rennissance up the road...
Old smell, not the best upkeep. Only good thing is location. They do not deal with crowds well. Avoid the pool courtyard, it is very loud.
reviews.title: Road Crew lodging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel site says it went through an extensive remodeling. Unfortunately, in all that, you can't get out the old smell. Like when you go into the home of an elderly person, it smells a certain way, same thing. The room we were upgraded to was attached to a parlor, which was pretty cool. The bed was nice, not amazing. The rooms had regular tv's, not flat screens, which addd to the retro vibe. The staff was friendly. The proximity to restaurants and downtown activities is great, even though the rooms have no view. (It's only 5 stories high and you can't see over the convention center). I would rather check into other hotels if we were coming back to the area.
reviews.title: Good Location, Smells old!

reviews.text: I got the deal from hot-wire. We got a great price. The motel was nice. It was like any other Holiday inn. It was kind of slow. The bar closed early on Friday and wan't to go to the bar and it was closed by 11:00. was hoping to spend time on Sat in the bar and was again closed 11:00. The mail bartender was super nice.. He was very friendly, made great drinks and get service. The women with the tattoo is rude and slow and complains in front of everyone. The only front desk person that was nice was Tim the rest was rude and didn't seem to care.
reviews.title: good deal

reviews.text: We booked this hotel online and got a really good deal. It was a nice hotel. We arrived at 2pm and already had our room ready. In the evening for diner there was tons of restaurants near by. The parking was $15 per night. If you want to sleep in late do not get a room over looking the pool. 2 screaming kids woke us up way earlier than we wanted to get up. We work nights and that really sucked. Other than that it was a good hotel for the price.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, very good price.

aka: Holiday Inn Select St. Louis - Downtown (Conv Center) Hotel Saint Louis
description: Welcome to the Ramada Plaza Hotel - Downtown Convention Center! We are located in the heart of downtown Saint Louis, next to America's Convention Center, Edward Jones Dome-home of the Rams, 1 block from St. Louis' newest expansion area 'Washington Avenue' featuring unique dining, shopping boutiques and entertainment, and only 9 blocks from the New Busch Stadium, home of the 11 time World Champion St. Louis Cardinals! Visit Saint Louis' historical sites, St Louis Gateway Arch, Anheuser Busch Brewery, Busch Stadium, Forest Park Zoo, Lumiere Place, Casino Queen Riverboat Gaming, and St Louis Union Station. The Ramada Plaza Hotel Downtown Convention Center is only blocks from the Metro Link rail system. Travel to the 'Gateway City' on business or pleasure and enjoy superior banquet and meeting facilities, a 24 hour business center, complimentary wireless high speed Internet, 24-hour snack and convenience center, and our newest restaurant, the 9th Street Bar and Grille. Relax at the Ramada Plaza Hotel Downtown in own atrium indoor pool and exercise room. Our hotel features 291 beautifully appointed guest rooms and suites. Covered parking is available adjacent to the hotel for a fee. We're the perfect business address for visitors to AT&T, Proctor & Gamble, US Bank, Nestle Purina, CPI, Fiserv & Saint Louis University.
